author: lzybkr
body:
The [ToolTip property](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.management.automation.completionresult.tooltip?view=powershellsdk-1.1.0#System_Management_Automation_CompletionResult_ToolTip) exists to give additional information about a completion.

XML documentation is available on many machines (often in `C:\Program Files (x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework\.NETFramework`) and should be used if available.

Parsing the XML is relatively straightforward, I found this [blog](https://www.brad-smith.info/blog/archives/220) useful, and more complete documentation [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/xmldoc/processing-the-xml-file) - check the license before taking any open source code though.
title: Tab completion should return XML documentation for tooltips
